title: NASA, ICON Advance Lunar Construction Technology for Moon Missions
summary: As NASA plans for long-term human exploration of the Moon under Artemis, new technologies are required to meet the unique challenges of living and working on another world.

title: China to finish busy Space station year with Shenzhou-15
summary:
China aims to launch the Shenzhou-15 mission to the Tiangong space station on Tuesday, Nov. 29, at 15:08 UTC from the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center (JSLC). The launch window for this mission is instantaneous. 

It will launch three taikonauts to the station to replace the current crew of the Shenzhou-14 mission. It will use a Chang Zheng 2F (CZ-2F) rocket and will launch from Space Launch Site 1 (SLS-1), which is also known as Site 901.

title: Orion flies far beyond the Moon, returns an instantly iconic photo
summary: "It’s really hard to articulate what the feeling is."

title: ESA’s ExoMars plans depend on NASA contributions
summary: While the European Space Agency has secured funding to continue the ExoMars mission for a 2028 launch, that plan requires cooperation with NASA that has yet to be finalized.

title: Artemis 1 mission reaches halfway point
summary: As the Artemis 1 mission reaches the halfway mark, NASA managers are adding additional test objectives for the Orion spacecraft to prepare for the vehicle’s first crewed flight.

title: Demonstration of new layer of missile-warning satellites planned for 2026
summary: The U.S. Space Systems Command announced Nov. 28 that two satellite designs — one by Millennium Space Systems and the other by Raytheon Intelligence & Space — passed critical reviews and will move into the next phase of development.

title: We’ve reached the end of a bizarre Atlantic hurricane season
summary: This was the rare year when there were no August storms. Then things blew up.

title: China outlines pathway for lunar and deep space exploration
summary: China has laid out its pathway for robotic and crewed lunar and deep space exploration, with a number of missions building towards a permanent moon base.

title: Three Chinese astronauts ready for flight to Tiangong space station
summary: Three Chinese astronauts will strap into a Shenzhou spacecraft and rocket into orbit Tuesday in pursuit of China’s Tiangong space station on a six-month mission to transition the space lab from construction into an operational phase.

title: SpaceX set to launch Japanese Moon lander, NASA ice surveyor cubesat
summary: SpaceX says it’s on track to launch Japanese startup ispace’s first Moon lander, HAKUTO-R M1, no earlier than (NET) 3:39 am EST...
